channel.title: Spooky Southcoast
channel.description: Two hours of paranormal talk visit www.spookysouthcoast.com for more info
channel.itunes:author: Tim Weisberg
channel.itunes:summary: SpookySouthcoast.com is the home of one of the world's top-rated paranormal talk shows. Delve into the world of the strange and unusual each week with host Tim Weisberg, "The Silent Assassin" Matt Costa, Science Adviser Matt Moniz and Content Director Chris Balzano. Ghosts, hauntings, UFOs, alien beings, cryptid creatures...nothing is taboo with the Spooky Crew!
channel.itunes:subtitle: Paranormal talk radio

item.title: May 19: ParaHunter and Phantom P.I.
item.description: "Spooky Southcoast" for May 19, 2012. Pete and Donna Stagman of ParaHunter join Tim and Moniz in the Spooky Studio to discuss their work and investigations; later in the program, Carlston "Chops" Wood checks in to discuss the latest episode of "Phantom P.I."
item.itunes:author: Tim Weisberg

item.title: May 5: First Ghost Encounters and NJ Haunted House
item.description: "Spooky Southcoast" for May 5, 2012. Tim is once again all by his lonesome in the Spooky Studio, but still manages to keep the show on the air. In the first hour, in recognition of his episode of My Ghost Story airing at the same time, he takes some calls from listeners sharing their first encounters with a ghost. Then in hour two, he is joined by Marianne Brigando and Pamela Solomon Maccabe from New Jersey Paranormal Investigators to discuss the haunted house in Toms River, New Jersey that recently made headlines.

item.title: April 28: Wicked Tuna, Jennifer Lauer and Haunted RI
item.description: "Spooky Southcoast" for April 28, 2012. With Tim holding down the fort on his own, the show hits a variety of topics as we discuss the new show "Wicked Tuna" with one of its stars, Capt. Ralph Wilkins; independent filmmaking with actress, writer and director Jennifer Lauer; and "Haunted RI" with Jason Mayoh and Christian White.

item.title: April 14: Slater Mill, My Ghost Story and Death Sauce
item.description: "Spooky Southcoast" for April 14, 2012. Ryleigh and Stephen Black of Black Cross Paranormal join us in the Spooky Studio to discuss some of their work, including their investigations of Slater Mill. Later, we are joined by Mark Phillips, executive producer of "My Ghost Story," and Jason Morey of South Coast Coneys swings by to issue the Death Sauce Challenge to everyone in the studio.

item.title: April 7: Daniel Johnson
item.description: "Spooky Southcoast" for April 7, 2012. Daniel Johnson joins us to discuss the Mormon religion and its belief in the paranormal. An eye-opening look into one of the most misunderstood religions.

item.title: March 31: The Real Lizzie Borden
item.description: "Spooky Southcoast" for March 31, 2012. We are joined by Michael Martins and Dennis A. Binette of the Fall River Historical Society to discuss their new book "Parallel Lives: A Social History of Lizzie A. Borden and Her Fall River." We discuss who the real Lizzie was, not the fabrication created through years of legend and lore.

item.title: February 25: Carrie Furmanick
item.description: With Tim and Moniz out at a Legend Trips event, Chris Balzano hosts the show and welcomes in guest Carrie Furmanick. They talk about the pitfalls of the paranormal, and at the end of the program we receive one of the most memorable phone calls in the history of the show.

item.title: February 18: Amityville with Ryan Katzenbach
item.description: "Spooky Southcoast" for February 18, 2012. Filmmaker Ryan Katzenbach joins us to talk about the release of Part I of his documentary trilogy "Shattered Hopes: The True Story of the Amityville Murders." Ryan delves into the real story behind the DeFeo family and what might have led Ronnie "Butch" DeFeo Jr. to slaughter his entire family in the house on 112 Ocean Avenue in November of 1974.

item.title: February 11: Christopher Balzano
item.description: "Spooky Southcoast" for February 11, 2012. Content Director Chris Balzano joins us as we talk about the recent trend of blaming crimes on paranormal causes, as well as whether or not paranormal enthusiasts suffer a stigma in their daily lives because of their pursuit. We also talk about the upcoming "shocking" episode of "Ghost Hunters" and whether or not it means Grant Wilson is leaving the show.

item.title: December 10: SouthCoast UFOs/Paranormal Media
item.description: "Spooky Southcoast" for December 10, 2011. The Spooky Crew discusses the recent rash of UFO sightings on the SouthCoast of Massachusetts; later, they talk about the glut of paranormal media and how it's doing nothing to further the field.

item.title: December 3: Geoff Holder, Bill Lichtenstein
item.description: "Spooky Southcoast" for December 3, 2011. We're joined by author Geoff Holder to talk about his works, including Jacobites and the paranormal and stories of body snatching, among other stories. Later in the show, we're joined by filmmaker Bill Lichtenstein to talk about his documentary "The American Revolution," about the beginning of legendary rock station WBCN.

item.title: November 26: Rock4Xmas Special
item.description: Rock4Xmas founder Wayne Morrison joins us for his annual visit to discuss the foundation and its upcoming slate of rock shows to benefit needy families. Also calling in was Craig Goldy of DIO and the legendary Eddie Money. Also checking in are Elisa Giannelli of Music Studio 307 and Jon Darling of The Neediest Families Fund.

item.title: November 12: Michael Ellegion/Claire the Haunted Doll
item.description: "Spooky Southcoast" for November 12, 2011. In the first hour, we talk with UFO contactee Michael Ellegion about his new book "Prepare for the Landings," and then in hour two, we talk about our in-studio guest Claire the Haunted Doll. Plus Pam Patalano joins in to talk about the upcoming Northern RI Paranormal and Metaphysical Fest.

item.title: October 22: Wendy Callahan and Patrick Meechan

In hour two, we talk with Patrick Meechan about his true story "220 Fifth Street," about living in back-to-back houses with demonic infestations.

item.title: August 20: The Sallie House
item.description: August 20, 2011. Dawn Pierce and Joe Cetrone join us to discuss the Sallie House in Atchison, Kansas, considered by many to be the most haunted house in the world. How did the supposed demonic entity that inhabits the house impact their lives? It's a chilling, cautionary tale for anyone who pursues the paranormal.

item.title: July 2: Mike Hallowell
item.description: July 2, 2011. We're joined by Mike Hallowell (www.mikehallowell.com) to talk about police work and the paranormal. Mike also fills us in on the fascinating Essex case that he's been investigating. You won't believe your ears when you hear what's going on...plus he gives us an exclusive statement from a law enforcement officer who was on the scene that you won't hear anywhere else!

item.title: April 30: Ben Radford
item.description: April 30, 2011. Ben Radford, author and managing editor of Skeptical Inquirer magazine, joins us to discuss how a skeptic views the paranormal and how he investigates claims scientifically. We also look at his recent work debunking the myth of the chupacabra.

item.title: April 23: The Shroud of Turin
item.description: April 23, 2011. We discuss the mystery of the Shroud of Turin with Dr. Andrew Silverman and author and researcher Nigel Kerner. Was it really the burial shroud for Jesus? What evidence does it give that he was resurrected? And what does this all have to do with gray aliens? We explore those questions and more.

item.title: April 2: The Bridgewater Triangle
item.description: We're joined in studio by Bridgewater Triangle researcher and historian Kristen Good, and via telephone by her colleague Manny Famolare. Also, Carlston "Chops" Wood is our special guest co-host for the evening as we discuss all the strangeness (and even some startling new revelations) regarding the mysterious Bridgewater Triangle.

In hour two, we talk with author and professor David Halperin about his first novel, "Journal of a UFO Investigator" and what he thinks UFOs truly are.

item.title: March 12: Tom Biscardi and the Bigfoot Hoax
item.description: March 12, 2011. Bigfoot hunter Tom Biscardi joins us to talk about his experiences tracking the elusive cryptid, his new film "Anatomy of a Bigfoot Hoax" and his role in the 2008 Bigfoot scandal that rocked the crypto-world.

item.title: March 5: Rusty McClure and Coral Castle
item.description: March 5, 2011. New York Times best-selling author Rusty McClure ("Crosley," "Cincinnatus") joins us to discuss Florida's Coral Castle and the mysterious man who built it, Edward Leedskalnin. How did this tiny man move these huge rocks? Was there supernatural or alien forces at work? And how does Ed tie into those titans of 20th century industry, the Crosley Brothers? Rusty takes us on a fascinating journey to find those answers.

item.title: February 19: Stanton Friedman and Kathleen Marden
item.description: February 19, 2011. We're joined by Stanton Friedman and Kathleen Marden to discuss their new book "Science Was Wrong." Stan and Kathy inform us about numerous instances where science attempted to stand in the way of progress, and how it still impedes UFO, alien abduction and psi research today.

item.title: February 12: Pirates, Witches and Other Local History
item.description: February 12, 2011. In the first hour, we're joined by author Kathleen Brunelle (www.kathleenbrunelle.com) to discuss her book "Bellamy's Bride: The Search for Maria Hallette of Cape Cod." Was Maria a witch and how was she connected to the pirate Black Bellamy? We go inside the stories. Also in hour two, we're joined by Wayne Ibn Musa Barboza of Parting Ways to discuss attempts to honor four slaves who fought in the American Revolution for the Plymouth Colony.

item.title: January 1: Paranormal Predictions
item.description: January 1, 2010. With our scheduled guest unavailable, Tim proclaims himself as the world's first "paranormal futurist" and gets one prediction in--the fall of paranormal reality television--which then takes over the show. John Brightman of New England Paranormal Research hangs out and joins in the discussion. Later, we talk with newest SpookySouthcoast.com contributor Nikki Wall.

item.title: December 18: Balzano Breaks Down Christmas
item.description: December 18, 2010. Christopher Balzano joins us for a patented "Balzano Breakdown" of the Spirit of Christmas as well as Christmas spirits. Chris shares some of his own holiday experiences, and gets in-depth about Dickens and his four ghosts. Tim and Chris also put the call out for help with their new book.

item.title: December 11: Amityville Revisited
item.description: December 11, 2010. Filmmaker Ryan Katzenbach ("Shattered Hopes: The True Story Behind the Amityville Horror") and Alexandra Holzer join us to discuss what really went on at 112 Ocean Avenue and the DeFeo family. Did Ronnie do it? Did he act alone? And for what reason would he murder his entire family? You have to tune in to find out!

item.description: December 4, 2010. Later in the show, spirit medium Tiffany Rice and Tracy Bjork of SPIES stop by to help promote Rock4Xmas.

item.title: November 27: Paranormal "Toys" and Ghosts of the SouthCoast
item.description: Tim and Matt Costa discuss what pieces of equipment paranormal investigators truly need on an investigation, and what fuels the desire to have the latest "toys" in the field. In the second hour, Tim discusses some of the stories behind writing his first book "Ghosts of the SouthCoast."

item.title: November 20: Haunted Plymouth, MA
item.description: Just in time for Thanksgiving, we are joined by Janice Williams of Dead of Night Ghost Tours, Tom Finn of Colonial Lantern Tours and Scott Stalter of Pilgrim Paranormal Research as we discuss the ghosts and legends of Plymouth, MA in a multicast with "Our History Project" radio. OHP host Craig Anderson joins in as our special guest co-host. Also, at the top of the show, we discuss the upcoming SouthCoast Toy and Comic Show with Steve Perry.

item.title: October 30: Jackie Barrett and the True Story of Amityville
item.description: October 30, 2010. We're joined by psychic medium Jackie Barrett, who shares with us not only her own dark experiences utilizing her abilities, but also the real story behind the Amityville murders. Jackie has worked closely with convicted murderer Ronald "Butch" DeFeo, Jr. for almost two years, and tells us exactly what led him to kill and what dark force remains in his life...and has extended to hers as well. SHOCKING revelations about the case you won't hear anywhere else!

item.title: Oct. 23: Stanley A. Fulham
item.description: October 23, 2010. Hot on the heels of the UFO sightings over New York, we speak with Stanley A. Fulham, the former NORAD official who predicted their arrival. Mr. Fulham discusses his work with the Transcendors and his new book "Challenges of Change." We also talk about paranormal evidence with Luann Joly of Whaling City Ghosts, and Christopher Balzano breaks down the proliferation of pukwudgies.

item.description: September 25, 2010. We're joined by Dan Gordon and Mickey Bradley to talk about their new book "Field of Screams," the sequel to "Haunted Baseball." They share stories about Tiger Stadium, Roberto Clemente, Babe Ruth and of course the Red Sox and Yankees.

item.description: August 28, 2010. We're joined by author and investigator S.M. Belekurov to talk about his new book "2012: The Paranormal Cookbook." We talk about various kinds of paranormal phenomena and whether or not it is all tied into the concept of the Mayan predictions of 2012.

item.title: August 21: Louis Charles and Peter Robbins
item.description: August 21, 2010. In an abbreviated show due to the Red Sox, we spend the first half-hour talking with Louis Charles (helpingghosts.com) about how to help ghosts cross over and the differences between ghosts, angels and demons. Then in the bottom half of the show, Peter Robbins informs us about the upcoming Exeter (NH) UFO Festival, and about the "Incident at Exeter" back in 1965.

item.title: August 7: Ghosts of Route 66
item.description: August 7, 2010. In the first hour, we're joined by Janice Tremeear and Alicia Holder and the gang from Route 66 Paranormal Alliance to talk about the ghosts and legends along "The Mother Road," Route 66. Then in hour two, Derek Bartlett of CAIPRS talks Cape Cod ghosts and his upcoming conference, and then Chris Balzano gives us a "Balzano Breakdown" on road legends and fills us in on the all-new SpookySouthcoast.com.

item.title: July 31: Faye Musselman and the Real Lizzie Borden
item.description: July 31, 2010: Expert and historian Faye Musselman joins us to discuss the real Lizzie Borden, and separate the myths that have come up through paranormal investigation from the historical Lizzie. She also drops a major bombshell on us regarding one of the long-standing rumors about the Bordens. Rev. Clarissa Vasquez from CCPI sits in with us as well, visiting from Colorado.

item.title: July 24: Jeff Belanger and Legend Tripping
item.description: June 24, 2010: Jeff Belanger, author of the new book "Picture Yourself Legend Tripping," joins us in the Spooky Studio to discuss the idea of legends, and how the paranormal field should start gravitating back toward them. He also asks for the help of the listeners in writing the foreword for Tim's forthcoming book. Oddballs Andrew Lake and Sarah Samways join in the fun as well.

item.title: July 10: Commander Sanni Ceto
item.description: July 10, 2010. We are joined by Commander Sanni Ceto, the extraterrestrial who piloted the alien ship that crashed in Roswell, New Mexico in July of 1947. Now reincarnated in alien-human hybrid form, Commander Sanni shares with us her special message for the people of Earth.

item.title: June 12: Murderabilia and Rocky Point Park

Then, later in the show, we are joined by artist Jason Mayoh to discuss the upcoming Rocky Point exhibit at the Warwick Museum of Art.

item.description: "Spooky Southcoast" for May 1, 2010. item.title: March 27: King Philip's War Controversy
item.description: "Spooky Southcoast" for March 27, 2010. Guest host: Andrew Lake. Guests: Professor Julianne Jennings, John Poniske. item.description: "Spooky Southcoast" for March 20, 2010. Guest: Robert Murch. We discuss the history of talking boards, including the ubiquitous Ouija board, with historian and collector Robert Murch. Murch also tells us the story of William Fuld, the man who made Ouija famous.

item.title: March 13: Laura Magdalene Eisenhower
item.description: "Spooky Southcoast" for March 13, 2010. Guest: Laura Magdalene Eisenhower. Laura, the great-granddaughter of President Dwight D. Eisenhower, talks with us about a variety of topics. She tells us of how she was targeted by a New World Order for her role in bringing about a new consciousness, and how they tried to silence her by sending her to a secret alien colony on Mars.

item.title: February 6: The John Lennon Death Prophecy
item.description: "Spooky Southcoast" for February 6, 2010. On the eve of the 46th anniversary of The Beatles' arrival in America, we talk with Joe Niezgoda, author of "The Lennon Prophecy." Did John Lennon sell his soul to the Devil to reach untold fame? Did Ol' Scratch come to collect through the guise of Mark David Chapman? And are there clues in The Beatles' music?

item.title: January 30: Alexandra Bruce and 2012
item.description: "Spooky Southcoast" for January 30, 2010. Guest: Alexandra Bruce. We're joined by the author of "2012: Science or Superstition," Alexandra Bruce, who helps us make sense of why so many believe some sort of earth-changing event is going to occur on Dec. 21, 2012. Why should we take heed of predictions made by the Mayan people ages ago, and what exactly did they predict? Alexandra has the answers.

item.title: October 17: Munster, Call In
item.description: "Spooky Southcoast" for October 17, 2009. We were supposed to talk with Butch Patrick, best known as TV's Eddie Munster, but it turns out a hurricane in Mexico (where Butch was working) kept us from connecting. However, we still had a great time hanging out with Wayne Morrison of Rock4Xmas (www.rock4xmas.com) and we connected with Matt Moniz and Jeff Belanger at the Mass Monster Mash.

item.title: September 19: Uncle Creepy and Todd Sheets
item.description: "Spooky Southcoast" for September 19, 2009. Guests: Uncle Creepy; Todd Sheets. With the new film "Paranormal Activity" creating a buzz, we talk to one of the few who've already seen it--DreadCentral's Uncle Creepy. Also, legendary horror director and host of "Nightwatch" Todd Sheets checks in as well. Plus, we get live UFO reports from the listeners--but it turns out it was just a NASA suborbital rocket launch.

item.title: August 8: Richard Felix and Ron Kolek
item.description: "Spooky Southcoast" for August 8, 2009. Guest: Richard Felix. Guest host: Ron Kolek. Director of the New England Ghost Project and host of "The Ghost Chronicles," Ron Kolek, joins us in the Spooky Studio as we talk to Richard Felix, who woke up at 3 a.m. (UK time) to speak with us. Richard, best known as the paranormal historian for "Most Haunted," shares a lively discussion of the nature of the paranormal with us, as we try to figure out what's "Most Haunted"--"Old" England or "New" England. There are a few moments of missing audio, due to a technical glitch (and thanks once again to Craig Anderson for bailing us out!)

item.title: August 1: Lizzie Borden and What Is a Ghost?
item.description: "Spooky Southcoast" for August 1, 2009. Guests: Jill Dalton, Faye Musselman. Guest host: Jeff Belanger. The one and only Jeff Belanger returns for his monthly co-hosting gig after a brief hiatus, and he asks the question, "What is a ghost?" The answer isn't as easy as you'd think. We also talk about the Lizzie Borden case and its paranormal legacy with actress Jill Dalton and Borden expert Faye Musselman. And, to top it all off, Jeff gives away concert tickets to one (un)lucky caller.

item.title: February 28: Paranormal Blues
item.description: "Spooky Southcoast" for February 28, 2009. We celebrate Black History Month with our special episode on Paranormal Blues. Carl "Chops" Wood joins us in studio to jam, and Mike Rugel of the Uncensored History of the Blues podcast joins us to talk about the legendary tales of the supernatural surrounding blues music. Plus plenty of tunes from Robert Johnson, Lonnie Johnson and Peetie Wheatstraw. Be sure to listen to the "encore" after the show.

item.title: January 24: Tim Miller
item.description: "Spooky Southcoast" for January 24, 2009. Guest: Tim Miller. We discuss how much President Gerald Ford knew about the assassination of John F. Kennedy and what he had to say about the Warren Commission's findings with Tim Miller, who published President Ford's last work and spoke with him extensively regarding JFK and the potential of a conspiracy.

item.title: December 20: The Fearing Tavern
item.description: "Spooky Southcoast" for December 20, 2008. Guest co-host: Jeff Belanger. Guests: Carlston Wood, Mike Markowicz, Andrew Lake. We discuss our investigation of the Fearing Tavern in Wareham, MA. Built in 1693, we were the first paranormal investigators to ever check out the building, and we got some really cool EVPs you just have to hear! In addition, we debut Jeff's holiday recording, "My Christmas Tree is Haunted."

item.title: November 22: Saint John Hunt and the JFK Conspiracy
item.description: "Spooky Southcoast" for November 22, 2008. Guest: Saint John Hunt. Guest Host: Jeff Belanger. On the 45th anniversary of the assassination of President John F. Kennedy, we're joined by Saint John Hunt (www.saintjohnhunt.com), son of CIA spy E. Howard Hunt. Saint talks with us about his father's involvement and what he revealed about about the conspiracy to kill JFK. Jeff Belanger also sits in with us, as he will do once each month.

item.title: June 10: The Lizzie Borden Case

item.title: June 3: Charlie Mattingly of Waverly Hills
item.description: "Spooky Southcoast" for June 3, 2006. Guest: Charlie Mattingly. Topic: Waverly Hills Sanatorium. We talked with the owner of Waverly Hills about its haunted history and their plans for the future. Also joining us was Staff Sgt. Joseph Gonski (U.S. Army retired), who talked about his investigation of Waverly Hills with our resident Science Advisor Matt Moniz. We also played an audio package on the Antichrist, debuted our new Hour 2 opening theme, played all versions of our most recent EVP from Ellis Bolles, and checked in with our newest fan down in Texas!

item.title: May 27: The Bell Witch Haunting
item.description: "Spooky Southcoast" for May 27, 2006. Guests: Ric White and Linda Thornton. Topic: The Bell Witch Haunting. We talk with Ric and Linda who made the first film about the Bell Witch about the legend, what's fact and what's myth, and the discrepancies between what's known and what was in the new film "An American Haunting." We also debuted our second EVP from Ellis Bolles Cemetery, and "Jon" called in to share his family's experience with the Witch of Cove Street.

item.title: May 6: Richard Senate
item.description: "Spooky Southcoast" for April 6, 2006. Guest: Richard Senate. We discuss "Haunted Hollywood," and some of the nearly 250 investigations Mr. Senate has conducted. He was also one of the first "ghost hunters" on the web way back in 1995 (www.ghost-stalker.com) so we get his take on the number of groups and websites out there today.

item.description: "Spooky Southcoast" for April 29, 2006. Guest: Brian Harnois of TAPS and "Ghost Hunters." We talked with Brian about his experiences investigating the paranormal, as well as some of his scarier (and funnier) moments. Later in the show, we were also joined by TAPS demonologist Keith Johnson. In addition, we debuted the EVP we captured at the Ellis Bolles Cemetery the previous week, and we had some inside information on the investigation of the whaling ship Charles W. Morgan.

item.title: February 11, 2006: The Bridgewater Triangle
item.description: "Spooky Southcoast" for February 11, 2006. Guests: Christopher Pittman and Aaron Cadieux. Topic: The Bridgewater Triangle. While this was actually our third show, it's the first one we put up on iTunes and it's the one that really got "Spooky Southcoast" going. By far our most popular episode yet, we discussed all the paranormal phenomena associated with the Triangle, including UFOs, alien abductions, ghosts, cult activity, Bigfoot sightings and more!

item.itunes:summary: "Spooky Southcoast" for February 11, 2006. Guests: Christopher Pittman and Aaron Cadieux. Topic: The Bridgewater Triangle. While this was actually our third show, it's the first one we put up on iTunes and it's the one that really got "Spooky Southcoast" going. By far our most popular episode yet, we discussed all the paranormal phenomena associated with the Triangle, including UFOs, alien abductions, ghosts, cult activity, Bigfoot sightings and more!

item.title: February 18, 2006: CAIPRS
item.description: "Spooky Southcoast" for February 18, 2006. Guests: Derek Bartlett, Joann McCann, and Deb Ahern of the Cape and Islands Paranormal Research Society (CAIPRS). Topics: investigating paranormal Cape Cod. We also discussed Shadow People as well.

item.title: February 25, 2006: Penny Dreadful
item.description: "Spooky Southcoast" for February 25, 2006. Guest: Penny Dreadful and her gang of ghouls. Topics: Horror movies and horror movie curses. The witch and her crew from "Penny Dreadful's Shilling Shockers" (www.shillingshockers.com) join us for a night discussing the horror genre, its current state, and some of the curses around movies like "Poltergeist," "The Omen," and "The Exorcist."

item.title: March 4, 2006: John Zaffis
item.description: "Spooky Southcoast" for March 4, 2006. Guest: John Zaffis. Topics: demonic possession and paranormal investigation. We talk with John about his experiences battling the demonic, and his apprenticeship under his aunt and uncle, Ed and Lorraine Warren. We also discussed some of the haunted items in his paranormal museum, and his first book, "Shadows of the Dark."

item.title: March 11, 2006: Budd Hopkins
item.description: "Spooky Southcoast" for March 11, 2006. Guest: Budd Hopkins. Topics: UFOs and UFO abductions. We had a terrific talk with Budd, the founder of the Intruders Foundation and a pioneer in the field of abduction phenomena.

item.title: March 18, 2006: Christopher Balzano
item.description: "Spooky Southcoast" for March 18, 2006. Guest: Christopher Balzano. Topic: Paranormal Massachusetts. We discuss all aspects of Massachusetts' haunted history, with Chris, who is the administrator of the Massachusetts Paranormal Crossroads website (www.masscrossroads.com).

item.title: March 25, 2006: Kristyn from "Ghost Hunters"
item.description: "Spooky Southcoast" March 25, 2006. Guest: Kristyn Gartland of The Atlantic Paranormal Society (TAPS) and the Sci-Fi Channel show "Ghost Hunters." We were also suprised via telephone by demonologist and TAPS member Keith Johnson, who shared with us some EVPs of when he took on the inhuman spirit that had seized control of Kristyn's home.

item.title: April 15, 2006: Peter Robbins
item.description: "Spooky Southcoast" April 15, 2006. Guest: Peter Robbins, co-author of "Left at East Gate," about the December 1980 UFO sightings at two airbases surrounding the Rendlesham Forest in the United Kingdom. Features audio evidence of the sigthings, as well as Peter's take on those who call the incident a "hoax."
